runs.comm: and he finds a great line straight away, as Lumb nudges to midwicket
fuller this time, and Lumb tries to bunt it back past Benn, who lopes across to cut it off
first international runs for Lumb, as he eases Benn through the covers for a couple
not much wrong from Benn, but Lumb shuffles across to change the line and picks up a few more to midwicket
just held back a touch by Benn, and Lumb punches it watchfully back to the bowler
full, straight, and driven much more firmly this time. Benn sticks out a big boot but can't stop the ball, and mid off cleans up
Rampaul errs slightly in line, as the ball shoots past the leg stump from over the wicket
shot! Too short from Rampaul, Lumb had moved forward but rocked back easily to smite the ball through midwicket. Pulled on length
loose start here, as Rampaul fires one very wide of off stump this time
crashed away! The ball was similarly short and wide to the last one, and Lumb, trusting the pace and bounce of the surface, slapped the ball very hard between point and cover
sloppy stuff from Rampaul, who oversteps by a good three inches. There's a misfield in the covers too.
Lumb swishes wildly at a slightly short ball, but can't connect. He missed out there, that was there to be hit
much better length and line, chopped down to point
all sort from Rampaul, this one is short again and Lumb pulls powerfully to midwicket but there's a fielder there to cut it off
that wasn't all that short, but Lumb stayed back and muscled the ball to midwicket to keep the strike
uppish! The ball was floated on leg stump and Lumb chipped it just wide of Gayle at midwicket, the ball rolls away to the boundary
and again! This was hit much more cleanly though, Lumb picking the vacant midwicket area and hitting the ball high over Gayle's head this time
pushed down to long on, and finally Kieswetter gets strike
flighted on off stump, Kieswetter presses forward but his prod is beaten by some nice turn from Benn
a touch shorter and slapped straight to cover
Kieswetter comes forward again and pushes the ball into the covers, no run!
short and Lumb pulls powerfully and in the air, but the ball bounces short of the man in the deep
Gayle tosses up a shocker. The ball was short and wide and just screamed hit me, and Kieswetter did just that to get off the mark
better from West Indies' captain, but the ball is pushed out to mid off for one

gone this time! Gayle makes amends for the shocker with a floater on leg stump. Lumb went for the swipe over wide midwicket but was beaten in the flight, practically yorking himself, and his stumps are splayed! West Indies really needed that wicket, they had been looking very flat

very full, practically a yorker on off stump but Pietersen has somehow squirted that past point for four! The ball was much quicker, and Pietersen just lent on it to ease the ball to the boundary. Top shot!
held back a touch, KP taps the ball down to long on to collect a single and keep the strike
close! Big shout first ball as KP presses half forward and is wrapped on the pads. Nope, big inside edge on that. He didn't look all that comfortable though
fuller on off stump, KP stays leg side of the ball to smash it down to long off for a couple
and again, he stays inside the line to work the ball into the off side
Kieswetter goes big! And that's huge, a clean strike sails high over long off and England are up and running again after the wicket
the batsman takes a couple of steps down the track to slap the ball hard down to long off. These two certainly aren't playing the spinners with soft hands, going very hard at everything
and KP almost falls over his own feet as Miller fires in a quicker one at his pads. Gets the bat down just in time though
Rampaul finds a tight line to start, and Kieswetter defends back down the track
slammed away! Kieswetter shimmied down the track, made some room and heaved way over long off. That's another great strike from Kieswetter, who's striking the ball very cleanly now
Rampaul fires in the yorker but Kieswetter gets across and jabs the bat down just in time, and the ball squirts to fine leg
leg stump line and KP whips to midwicket
full again, and flicked fine for one
Rampaul drags the length back and the ball spits up off a length, somewhat surprising the batsman. No harm done though
watchfully tapped back to the bowler
it's raining sixes in Guyana now! Absolutely walloped over wide long off, he's creamed that!

but Miller's revenge is quick! He held the ball back bravely, flighting it and Kieswetter was stuck in two minds. He was struck on the back leg right infront, and West Indies nip this partnership in the bud at exactly the right time!
Colly tries to nurdle the ball away behind square but can't beat the fielder
cheeky! Collingwood goes for a reverse paddle and pulls it off admirably. A great sliding stop from Sammy on the boundary saves a run
just a bit too short and KP rocks back to hammer the ball into the covers, and some very sharp running gets him two
hits a length first ball, but Collingwood slaps it back past him and down to long on for one
floaty delivery on off stump and Pietersen drives hard out to long off
quicker and shorter, Colly stays inside the line and works the ball into the off side, finding the gap in the covers to collect a single
great line as KP is tucked up by a ball angling in to him. Not much he can do with that
and again, Sammy is attacking the stumps here, bowling a very straight line and getting the ball to snake in to the batsman just a little
KP uses what little width is on offer to collect a run infront of point on the off side
tossed up on middle and leg. KP backs away to try to make some room and drops the ball into the off side but can't find the placement
Pietersen is down on one knee and sweeping, they run a sharp single as the fielder comes in from square leg. There's an appeal for the run out, but Collingwood was well in
pushed down to long on
just slightly short on off stump, Pietersen rocks back to flay the ball through the covers and they sprint two
Pietersen comes down the track but Miller sees him coming, spearing in a quicker ball on leg stump. They collect a single all the same
zoning in on leg stump, and Collingwood misses with an attempted nurdle to leg.
pulled away in the air to deep midwicket, but falling short of the fielder
well, it's the dilscoop from Colly, but it doesn't come off and he cops a painful blow on the knee.

Collingwood goes, Sammy strikes! Sammy fired in a quicker one as Collingwood stayed back to try and work the ball away, but by the time he got his bat down his stumps had been flattened. Great bowling!
too short from Sammy, Morgan gets inside it to nudge the ball to midwicket and get off the mark
short again and, extraordinarily, Pietersen has pulled that one-handed and the ball has sailed over the ropes at square leg! That was hit into the breeze as well, what a shot! Sahil is mesmerized!

Gone! Sammy is jubilant as Pietersen is caught on the midwicket boundary attempting a repeat of the shot! It's a shouting, fist-pumping celebration, you can tell how much that wicket means to West Indies
worked away through the covers for one
Wright presses forward to defend
a touch of width offered outside off, but the ball is chopped straight to point
and again, hit straight to the fielder on the off side
too short from Miller, and Wright rocks back to jab the ball through midwicket
Morgan unfurls the reverse sweep immediately to pick up one to third man
short and pulled very high out to midwicket, plugging in the surface as it bounces
drifting down leg
that's better, Sammy raps Morgan on the pads with a ball fired at middle and leg
short and inviting the pull, but the ball bounces a good three metres infront of the fielder on the square leg boundary
good, tight line from Sammy, who's doing everything asked of him as Wright defends back down the track
on a length on off stump and Wright swings mightily, almost knocking himself over, but the result is a quiet single down to long on as the ball squirts off the toe of the bat
on leg stump, and Morgan gets across to work the ball into the gap infront of square on the leg side
on the money straight away, and Morgan flicks straight to the midwicket fielder
short from Bravo, Morgan swivelled to pull and the ball took the top edge. Amazingly, that's carried over the ropes for six! It was nothing more than a top edge really, but that's landed well over
tapped back down the wicket
good shot, Morgan spotted the width and ran the ball off the face down to third man. Top shot for one run
well, Wright is trying to hit the covers off everything but it's not quite coming off as he swishes airily past this one
that's better. One run is better than no runs, as Wright drives the ball out to long on to keep the strike
Wright searching for the boundary, but his muscly heave finds the midwicket fielder
on a length on off stump, and Morgan backs away to chop the ball down to third man
thumped down to long off by Wright
Sammy cramps Morgan for room from over the wicket, and all he can do is push the ball to mid off
fuller and Morgan spotted it early, trying to loft the ball back over his head, but it took the inside edge, squirting off the edge onto the pad as Fletcher cleans up behind the stumps
whipped away to midwicket
fired slightly wide by Bravo, and Morgan tried to flash the ball square but ended up playing and missing
worked away for one this time.
swiped to midwicket by Wright
improvisation from Morgan! He moved across to play a paddle pull off the front foot, but the man at fine leg sprinted round to cut it off
Morgan stays back and picks up one as he drops the ball into the off side
an ungainly swipe to deep mid off from Wright gets England one as the batsmen scamper a sharp single
well, Wright just danced down the track and aimed a fearsome hoick down to long on. That was just over Benn on the ropes, as the ball never really got up, but that was hit very, very hard
slower ball, and Wright crashes it down to long off
straying onto Morgan's pads, and the batsmen collect two with some quick running
short and Morgan pulls out to midwicket in the air, but the ball falls short of the fielder
heaved away by Wright! He's starting to middle the hits now, that's an 86-metre six, a towering hit over wide long on
Wright swings again at a slower ball, but the mistimed shot goes straight back to the bowler
Morgan gets his front foot out of the way and swings, but picks out deep mid off and they turn down the single
great shot! The ball was slower, and pitched up and Morgan placed the shot perfectly, beating the bowler and mid off and collecting a boundary
Morgan can't connect with the heave, but Wright charges through and Fletcher behind the stumps can't get round to collect the ball in time and they pick up a leg bye
swung away to midwicket by Wright. Gosh he tries to hit it hard
Morgan shuffles across and flicks the ball out to long leg, but Benn gets around to cut it off before the rope
another six for Morgan! He stayed deep in the crease, shuffling across and sending the ball in an arc way, way over square leg. Very powerful, wristy pull off the front foot gets him a maximum!
an almighty heave from Wright sends the ball sailing over midwicket! That was too short from Rampaul, allowing Wright to get under it. He hit that so hard!
and another! Wright walks down the track and aims a mighty blow that sails way over long on! That's a 91-metre six, and its set the England fans cheering!
the pressure's getting to Rampaul here, he's overstepped and that's a cardinal sin at any time in a Twenty20
six more! Morgan takes full toll of the free hit to send the ball straight back over Rampaul's head!

Unbelievable! Extraordinary! What kind of a shot is that? He's just stood at the crease and reverse-lapped a half volley on off stump over short third man and away to the ropes. Morgan is enjoying himself here
hammered away square this time
more length from Rampaul, and Morgan runs the ball down to third man in a surprisingly orthodox manner
Morgan gets down to reverse sweep but can't connect. Fletcher doesn't collect cleanly though, and they steal a bye
driven very hard out into the covers. Wow, there are no half-measures from Wright
edged away, and first slip would have lapped that up, but Morgan collects two and that's his fifty. A superbly-paced knock, just what England needed from him
audacious shot! Out comes the reverse sweep once again, and he's nailed it this time to send the ball in the air down to third man
dropped into the covers for one

ha! And Wright has literally swung the bat out of his hands with that shot! He tried to heave the ball through midwicket, didn't get a good connection but swung so hard that the bat flew out of his hands and only landed past square leg!
round the wicket comes Bravo, and Wright steps away to give himself room and drives through the covers for one

and he's out this time! Bravo dished the ball up on off stump and Morgan threw everything at it. It's six or sticks at this stage, but he couldn't quite get the elevation or distance, and Pollard took a good tumbling catch running in from the boundary
hammered down to long off
and Wright picks up where Morgan left off, trying the switch hit but he couldn't execute the shot, finding only fresh air
leg stump half volley and Wright chips powerfully out to cow corner, top shot
hammered out to midwicket, and manic running gets England two more from the final delivery!
